Name: Driver assistance centers.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to driver assistance services

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Amendment Proposed by Comm
This Introduction was Amended by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Summary: This bill would require the Taxi and Limousine Commission (“TLC”) to provide TLC-licensed drivers assistance including financial counseling, mental health counseling and referrals to non-profit organizations for additional assistance.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 5 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new section 19-551 to read as follows:
      � 19-551 Driver assistance. a. Driver assistance services. The commission, in consultation with the department of consumer affairs, the department of small business services and any other agencies designated by the mayor, shall provide services and information to assist drivers, or owners of vehicles, licensed by the commission including but not limited to financial counseling, mental health services and referrals to non-profit organizations or other entities that may provide additional assistance to such drivers or owners. The commission may provide such services and information through the unit that issues licenses, the website of the commission, or such other means as the commission deems appropriate. 
      � 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law.

NB/JJD
LS 7711, 7548
11/5/18 4:00pm
